newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times business - Sept 4.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times business - Sept 4.

text.p: The New York Times reported the following business stories on Wednesday:
* Moves against Iraq send oil prices surging.
* U.S. factory activity expands for the third consecutive month in August.
* United Auto Workers choose Ford Motor Co as their lead contract target.
* Olivetti chairman Carlo De Benedetti resigns.
* Chrysler Corp reports a nine percent sales rise in August.
* Settlement is reached in suit between travel agents and major U.S. airlines.
* The Dow Jones Industrial Average ends up 32.18 points at 5,648.39.
* Underwriter Stratton Oakmont's latest plans are to take E-Net Inc public.
* Advertising agency Arnold Communications is now vying for national attention.
* Airbus Industrie wins $3 billion in new orders.
* Borders Books and Music opens huge store in Manhattan.
